channel.title: Portforwarding Issue
channel.description:
Alright, so I made myself a static IP address for my new computer, Removed the protocols for my old one (ports 43594, and 25565). Made new ones for those ports on the new static IP both TCP and UDP, but it doesn't work. When I start up my Minecraft Server it says that it couldn't bind to the port and says that the port may already be in use (but by what?) and when I try to use a chat program I'm making it can't create a socket based on my IP and port 43594.
These are the two protocols.
[URL=http://img819.imageshack.us/i/unledtro.png/][IMG]http://img819.imageshack.us/img819/6553/unledtro.png[/img][/URL]
Minecraft Error: [code][WARNING] **** FAILED TO BIND TO PORT! [WARNING] The exception was: java.net.BindException: Cannot assign requested address: JVM_Bind [WARNING] Perhaps a server is already running on that port?[/code]
Chat Program Error: [code]Client will attempt to connect to the server at-NOIPFORYOU! port-43594 .
Username: df Message: df
java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketConnect(Native Method) at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.doConnect(Unknown Source) at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.connectToAddress(Unknown Source) at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.connect(Unknown Source) at java.net.SocksSocketImpl.connect(Unknown Source) at java.net.Socket.connect(Unknown Source) at java.net.Socket.connect(Unknown Source) at java.net.Socket.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.net.Socket.<init>(Unknown Source) at Client.main(Client.java:62) Something bad happened. Message:[/code]
Line 62 in Client.java [code]Socket skt = new Socket(host,port);[/code]
Any ideas? Please? Anyone?

item.title: Portforwarding Issue
item.dc:creator: @sp11k3t3ht3rd sp11k3t3ht3rd
item.description:
@sp11k3t3ht3rd wrote:

Alright, so I made myself a static IP address for my new computer, Removed the protocols for my old one (ports 43594, and 25565). Made new ones for those ports on the new static IP both TCP and UDP, but it doesn’t work. When I start up my Minecraft Server it says that it couldn’t bind to the port and says that the port may already be in use (but by what?) and when I try to use a chat program I’m making it can’t create a socket based on my IP and port 43594.

These are the two protocols.

Minecraft Error:

[WARNING] **** FAILED TO BIND TO PORT! [WARNING] The exception was: java.net.BindException: Cannot assign requested address: JVM_Bind [WARNING] Perhaps a server is already running on that port?

Chat Program Error:

[code]Client will attempt to connect to the server at-NOIPFORYOU! port-43594 .

Username: df
Message: df

java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect
at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketConnect(Native Method)
at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.doConnect(Unknown Source)
at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.connectToAddress(Unknown Source)
at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.connect(Unknown Source)
at java.net.SocksSocketImpl.connect(Unknown Source)
at java.net.Socket.connect(Unknown Source)
at java.net.Socket.connect(Unknown Source)
at java.net.Socket.(Unknown Source)
at java.net.Socket.(Unknown Source)
at Client.main(Client.java:62)
Something bad happened.
Message:[/code]

Line 62 in Client.java

Any ideas? Please? Anyone?

Read full topic
